nodes.bodyText: Leave the date as TBD, we'll set it when we do a release. We normally do minor version releases if we update libraries so go with 15.2.0 as the version number.

Can you put the full maven artifact id in for this and the one below and then also mention what the previous version in use was (see below in changelog for examples of when we've done this in the past).

Please use the long name for the arguments as they are more readable (i.e. --activate-profiles instead of -P).
The coveralls repo token argument needs to be put back.
Why did you add --quiet?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,15 +1,14 @@
 language: java
 jdk:
-  - openjdk7
+  - openjdk8
 os:
   - linux
-dist: trusty
 cache:
   directories:
     - ~/.m2/repository
 install:
-  - mvn install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true --quiet --batch-mode --show-version --activate-profiles travis
+  - mvn install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true --quiet --batch-mode --show-version
 before_script:
   - echo "MAVEN_OPTS=${TEST_MEM_SETTINGS}" > ~/.mavenrc
 script:
-  - mvn cobertura:cobertura coveralls:report --batch-mode --activate-profiles travis -DrepoToken=${COVERALLS_REPO_TOKEN} -Dtest.arguments="${TEST_MEM_SETTINGS}"
+  - mvn package jacoco:report coveralls:report --batch-mode -Dtest.arguments="${TEST_MEM_SETTINGS}" -P coveralls --quiet

nodes.bodyText:
good catch, didn't realize I removed the token.
Added quiet because travis was failing with : The job exceeded the maximum log length, and has been terminated., it doesn't look like it helped much. Will go ahead and revert this

nodes.bodyText: Let's not add this file in this PR, I need to generate an add the coveralls token for the action so I'd rather do that in the other PR.
This is OK, you could also just have one line mentioning the property that you changed as it affects all 3 (and maybe some other dependencies in child modules).
Again, let's keep the GH action in the other PR.

nodes.bodyText: Please add this change to the changelog too as changing the parent can have side effects that we sometimes need to track down later.

Sorry, partly my mistake in my merge, I intended to move coveralls over to the GH action and not in Travis so we don't get two reports. Can you please remove coveralls:report and --activate-profiles coveralls from here. package and jacoco are enough.
